IDA Documentary Screening Series In Partnership with Indiewire Fall 2015 The Landmark Theater - 10850 W. Pico Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90064 (Map) The IDA Documentary Screening Series brings some of the year’s best documentary films to the IDA community and members of industry guilds and organizations. Films selected for the Series receive exclusive access to an audience of tastemakers and doc lovers during the important Awards campaigning season. Screenings conclude with a moderated Q&A with the filmmakers. The Series takes place at The Landmark Theater in Los Angeles. Don't miss a film! Register now to receive direct invitations to the IDA Documentary Screening Series. SCREENING DETAILS: Check in for all guests will begin 1 hour before the screening starts. Seating priority will be given to members of IDA, Guilds, and industry organizations who show their valid member cards at check in. You must show your organization membership card when you check in at the screening to access priority seating. Eligible organizations include: IDA, AMPAS, ATAS, DGA, WGA, PGA, FIND, ACE, BAFTA, BFCA, MPSE.   Seating for non-industry affiliated guests will begin 20 minutes before the screening starts.An RSVP does not guarantee admission. Parking is free for the first three hours, and $3 for an additional three hours with validation. Children under 17 must be accompanied by an adult. Schedule and programming subject to change. For any questions about the IDA Documentary Screening Series, email: screenings@documentary.org   SPONSORED BY:
